title: "Brain-activity recognition gets competitive with speech recognition"
excerpt: "For people with limited use of their limbs, speech recognition can be critical for their ability to operate a computer. But for many, the same problems that limit limb motion affect the muscles that allow speech. That can make any form of communication a challenge, as physicist Stephen Hawking famously demonstrated.
